definition: not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
(negative prefix)/not/no
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
surname Ye

sentences.english: Having spent his youth inidleness, he is having to work in his old age.
sentences.chinese: 他年輕時不務正業，年老時非辛苦工作不可。

sentences.english: He idled about and did no decent work.
Brother to work honestly, deceiving his wife often living on sisters relief.
sentences.chinese: 弟弟不務正業，瞞着妻子常靠姐姐的救濟過日子。

sentences.english: He is always loafing around and doing nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他經常遊手好閒，不務正業。

sentences.english: She had fondly loved her sinful but good-natured father.
sentences.chinese: 她很愛她的那個雖然不務正業而心地善良的父親。

definition: to work hard
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to become a mere formality
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
deep in debt
proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
to be reluctant to give up a post
penniless
to stake all on one throw
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to play deaf-mute
an extra (in a movie)
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
penniless (idiom)
